medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent infections and symptoms related to congenital neutropenia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 10 months of age with stomatitis, gingivitis, and cervical lymphadenomegaly. Recurrent stomatitis and impetigo developed during the second year. At 2 years old, the patient experienced anemia, recurrent fever, mucositis, and urinary tract infections. Stomatitis recurred every 2 to 4 weeks, accompanied by fever, gingivitis, cervical lymphadenomegaly, and angular cheilitis. From age 3, chronic constipation and alternating diarrhea occurred, along with steatorrhea. G-CSF treatment started at age 10 improved ANC counts and reduced infection frequency.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born from a pregnancy complicated with placental dysfunction, polyhydramnion, and pyelonephritis. After birth, she developed purulent conjunctivitis. All vaccines of the Ukrainian vaccination program were received except for hepatitis B.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother has recurrent herpes labialis, and the father has herpetic keratitis. Family history is negative for dysmorphic features, hematological disease, immune deficiency, or neonatal deaths.
